title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Tuesday 14 November 2017 - BBC News
summary: leicester city owners to fight '£ 323m lawsuit ' .
man jailed for life for street stabbing .

documents.title: derbys escape chesterfield pitch penalty
text: derbys escape chesterfield pitch penalty

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 wednesday morning .

documents.title: weather : foggy later
text: milder than recent nights due to cloudy conditions and patchy light rain and drizzle .
a widespread mix of low cloud and patchy fog will form by the early hours .
minimum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: watch : caped crusader returns to gotham
text: is it the caped crusader and his plucky sidekick ?
or del boy and rodney ?

documents.title: watch : citizens arrest for 'naughty ' purse snatcher
text: a would-be robber got more than he bargained for when he messed with terttu blackett in ruddington , nottinghamshire , last week .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your animal magic
text: a good day for getting back to nature today as our weather watchers have been finding out .
this snoozing ram was spotted at calke in derbyshire .
and this majestic heron was captured in ruddington , nottinghamshire .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: ken clarke 's brexit speech met with applause
text: rushcliffe mp ken clarke just received a round of sustained applause in the house of commons after his eu bill debate speech .
the clapping - which is n't allowed under parliamentary convention - came after his killer closing line : `` i am the rebel '' .
he said there were only two mps still in the house , who were present in 1972 when the european communities act was passed : labour mp for bolsover dennis skinner and himself .
pro-eu mr clarke adds that he and mr skinner have always voted in opposite ways on europe and the government have more chance of support from mr skinner than from him .

he said the idea has been `` put forward by ukip and others that [ the act ] led faceless , grey eurocrats to produce vast quantities of awful legislation and red tape is one of the biggest myths of our time '' .
but he paid tribute to former ukip leader nigel farage 's `` campaigning abilities '' , calling him `` the most successful politician of my generation '' .
he joked that people persuaded by mr farage `` are all looking forward to bent bananas again once we actually repeal this piece of legislation '' .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: guns handed to police during amnesty
text: derbyshire police have received 13 weapons in the first two days of a gun amnesty .
the force wants to take legally held weapons and replicas out of circulation so they do n't fall into criminal hands .
the 13 guns handed in so far include bb guns , a starting pistol , air riffles and a shotgun .
people wanting to hand in a weapon can do so at pear tree , st mary 's wharf , buxton or chesterfield police stations .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: archbishop takes the bus
text: here 's the archbishop of canterbury taking the hospital hopper from beaumont leys .
justin welby will be chatting to passengers as well as praying with them if they wish .
author: Danielle Hunt
BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: leicester celebs head for the jungle
text: the new line-up of i 'm a celebrity get me out of here has been announced - and there 's quite a showing from leicester .
among the famous faces we 'll be seeing getting hot and bothered down under include rebekah vardy , wife of foxes star jamie .
dennis wise - who played for leicester city from 2001 to 2002 - is also appearing on the itv show .
they 'll be battling to stay the three weeks in the jungle alongside boris johnson 's dad stanley , former boxing world champion amir khan and jennie mcalpine ( fiz from corrie ) .
find out the full lineup here .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : car crashes into m1 barrier
text: this crash has happened not far from ashby-de-la-zouch .
# derbyshire traffic temporarily halted , # a42 n/bound near # willesley , between the end of the # m42 at j11 and the # b5006 ( j12 ) .
a car has collided with the centre reservation barrier .
# leicestershire
- noted with thanks .
appreciate it 's close to the county border .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes player 'disgusted ' by transfer injustice
text: leicester midfielder adrien silva insists he was `` disgusted '' by the injustice which has left him in exile .
the portugal international can not play forthe foxes until january after the paperwork for his £ 22m move from sporting lisbon was filed 14 seconds after august 's transfer deadline .
leicester 's appeal was rejected by fifa which has left silva facing four months out and unhappy with the situation .
silva told portuguese public broadcaster rtp : `` i had a lot of desire to talk about the injustice .
i was disgusted by this , but people calmed me , they advised me that i had to let go of a painful time to express myself in a calmer , less aggressive way .
it was the best decision .
`` i can not hide that it was a big disappointment .
i felt a great disillusionment with everything that happened , which i was not responsible for , but i am the big loser .
it is not a short time without playing . ''
author: Press Association

documents.title: flooding closes school
text: a secondary school in langley mill is closed today because of flooding , derbyshire county council has said .
a post on one of aldercar school 's facebook pages says a broken sprinkler system has caused the electricity to be turned off throughout the school .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: alleged bomb plotter 'sent gory videos '
text: alleged bomb plotter 'sent gory videos '

documents.title: watch : charity helped by children in need
text: you probably know that this week sees the bbc children in need appeal reach its climax .
a large number of charities benefit from the money you help to raise - like changing faces .
i 've been to meet alessandra from hope valley whose life has been changed by the charity .
author: Oli Constable
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: house prices shoot up in part of leicestershire
text: hinckley and bosworth has seen the biggest rise in house prices in the uk , according to the ons .
the figures are for annual growth to september this year .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: controversial industrial building development approved
text: an industrial development near belper , which could create over 600 jobs , has been approved by councillors .
the local mp pauline latham and hundreds of members of the public had objected to the proposal .
historic england said it was concerned the proposed industrial buildings in bullsmoor would spoil the derwent valley world heritage site .
the decision may have to be reviewed by the government before work can start .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: councillors asked to rethink plans for new cemetery
text: a decision by charnwood borough council 's cabinet to put loughborough 's next cemetery near a developing housing estate , has n't gone down well .
five councillors have decided to call-in the decision bringing it back to the council for further discussion .
it was realised in 2007 that an extension to the existing cemetery would be needed by 2032 .
officers put together a 45-page report looking at five potential sites for a new cemetery for loughborough .
the allendale road site was judged to be the best but local councillors have called it in for a re-think .

councillor david hayes , who is one of the five who 've called the decision in , said people have raised concerns about property prices and had hoped the field would be used as a park or a playground for children on the estate .
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester reporter

documents.title: drivers warned about a1 breakdown
text: a message from police by the side of the a1 in rutland .
folks please drive carefully breakdown in live lane nearside , rutland .
a1 northbound half mile short of b668 to oakham hopefully clear by 2pm today .
thanks
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: afternoon weather update
text: it 'll be cloudy with the chance of some drizzly showers possible on and off throughout the day .
there will be some brightness where the cloud thins and breaks and the chance of a hint of sunshine .
highs of 12c ( 54f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: life sentence for street murder
text: an 18-year-old who stabbed a man to death with a single blow over a `` seemingly insignificant argument '' has been jailed for life for murder .
mucaad ali farah , from bishopdale road , in leicester killed abdirahman abdirizak mahmoud adam on st matthews way in leicester last may .
the 22-year-old died in hospital of a single stab wound to the chest .
leicestershire police said farah had shown no remorse .
a judge ordered him to serve a minimum of 14 years in prison .
author: Eric Simpson
BBC News Online

documents.title: nottingham mp questions brexit vote
text: the labour mp for nottingham east sounds off after david davis 's announcement yesterday that parliament will get a vote on the final brexit deal .
`` what is the point of offering a bill after a withdrawal agreement has been signed and sealed by ministers '' @ twitterid a bit of a sham ''
the full debate is here :
from what ms villiers has just said this government has no respect for half of the country who wish to stay within europe .
we had a referendum .
that 's democracy .
not everyone is going to be happy .
trouble is that leave voters are dying off and being replaced by young remain voters .
300,000 have died and 500,000 young people are now 18
the average age is increasing not decreasing .
yes , but it was the old at the time of the vote that voted leave and they are dying off .
the younger folk were remain and wo n't change votes
when democracy only belong to the young ?
never said it did .
just pointing out the fact that it was the old that voted leave and young remain .
16 & 17 yo voters are coming of age
the old leave voters are dying off .
this will change the demographics of remain/leave voting pools
the date 's on the bill to make sure these remoaners do n't scupper # brexit - great move imo
the date wo n't make it through either house of parliament .
if trade talks get delayed ( highly likely ) would be silly to be tied to a date
we decided we were leaving , the mps voted for it , we were told # brexit means brexit and we 'll be leaving in 2 years - put the date on and make it the deadline .
it 's only remoaners clinging on that want no date
the majority of mps and lords wo n't vote for a date .
brexit is n't guaranteed-if a deal can not be reached then staying in will be an option
nope , we are leaving , the mps past the bill and it has gone through parliament
mps can easily pass another bill to stop it .
that 's how parliament works
we 're leaving , get over it
i am over it thanks .
moved to spain with my husband and started my application for citizenship here .
i only worry about friends back there

why are some of these mp 's so hell bent on painting the worst possible of brexit i 've never heard such scaremongering and doubt in our countries ability to live , work and flourish outside a group of 27 nations , half of which we fund and prop up ! !
# boreoff # walkaway
rather `` what 's the point of mps trying to reverse brexit vote .
17.4m did n't vote for them '' .
author: The Daily Politics

documents.title: pupil caught with knife at school
text: police in leicester have just recovered this knife from a primary school in the city .
the force has posted on twitter to say the pupil was spoken to and `` appropriate referrals completed '' .
earlier today police said 17 knives had been recovered in a week-long policing operation in leicestershire .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man jailed for life for street stabbing
text: man jailed for life for street stabbing

documents.title: students and cleaners protest over pay
text: dozens of students and cleaners have joined a protest outside the university of nottingham over how much some of its staff are paid .
the university has been accused of short-changing its cleaners , cooks and estates workers by unions , including the university and college union .
although it pays workers the national living wage - £ 8.75 an hour - the unions have said this only happens for three months of the year due to different pay cycles .
the university says it has a fair `` pay and reward '' package .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: burst water pipe causing supply issues
text: sorry to be the barer of bad news but some people in leicestershire might find they do n't have any water .
there 's a burst water pipe in south croxton causing supplies to be off or at low pressure .
customers in the le7 area of leicester may be experiencing water supply interruptions today due to a burst water pipe in the area :
any update on how the repair is going ?
we are still working on the repair but tankering water into the network at various points to limit impact on our customers .
regards padraig
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: adam and eve musical cancelled
text: this is serpently disappointing ( sorry ) .
if a musical rendering of the biblical tale of the garden of eden sounds like a good night to you , then we 've got some bad news .
heaven on earth , telling the story of adam and eve , due to take place at nottingham 's motorpoint arena over three nights in january , has been cancelled .
the arena said the production company has taken the decision after `` delays with investment funding '' .
a post on eden international productions ' website has said the firm is about to go into liquidation and has cancelled the entire heaven on earth arena tour .
refunds will be made in the next 10 working days , the arena said .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: couple thank 'angels ' after firework destroys home
text: a woman from littleover whose house was wrecked by a firework said she 's been overwhelmed by the kindness of strangers .
a rocket came through the roof of wendy and ted bagshaw 's home on bonfire weekend .
since the fire , the couple have been given food parcels , clothes , money and invited into neighbours ' homes .
wendy said : `` everywhere around us are there are people that are angels .
they 're putting us first in front of themselves , which i 'll never know how to thank them .
there are n't enough words . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire dog chats to cops
text: just a dog wearing shoes sharing a joke with some police officers .
move along , nothing weird here .
first job sorted now on route to assist @ twitterid with a 2nd incident although dexter is busy chatting to the police officers
well he would like to say or get to know them or perhaps show off paw protection ?
ive had the privilege of meeting dexter and his dad dave twice marta they both get the up from me
your quite the celebrity adam
a ladies man
look i told you that you ca n't leave until i 'm ready .
good job dexter lucy sending ya woofs from liverpool keep doing your amazing job
dexter put the ladies down
you are amazing dexter !
well ! !
hello ,
dexter seems to have an eye for the pretty ladies
chatting to a lady in uniform
spaniels are so sociable
`` what d'you reckon to my new boots then officer ? ''
such a charmer !
bet she wanted to take you home .
love his wee shoes
smile for the camera
that 's a pcso , not a real cop .
so incredibly cute !
dexter , i know you 're really intelligent , but you are sooo handsome too .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'cash for crash ' scammers to repay thousands
text: members of a derbyshire gang which ran a complex insurance scam have been ordered to pay back more than £ 37,000 .
they orchestrated 41 `` cash for crash '' collisions between 2011 and 2013 where they would stage car crashes before submitting fraudulent insurance clams .
ten of the incidents happened at markeaton island in derby .
in april this year , 11 men were jailed for a combined total of more than 42 years for conspiracy to defraud .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: soubry : may pandering to hard brexit tories
text: broxtowe mp anna soubry has accused theresa may of pandering to hardline brexit supporters in her own party .
yesterday , brexit secretary david davis offered mps a vote on the final brexit deal - and mps are now set for hours of debate over the minutiae of the government 's brexit bill .
conservative mrs soubry said the offer was `` completely meaningless '' because mr davis `` could n't guarantee that we 'd have the vote before we left '' .

and , if the government failed to reach an agreement with the eu on its post-brexit relationship , parliament will have no say at all , which she said was not `` right '' for such an important decision .
`` after all , people voted to take back control and yet actually , control is going out of parliament , '' she said .

`` it 's going into the hands of a very small number of ministers , and i 'm afraid to say i think theresa may is really pandering to 35 hard brexiteer ideologues in my own party and that 's not right . ''
brexit minister robin walker insisted the government was focused on securing an agreement with the eu that would be backed by the majority of mps .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: religious leader welcomed to leicester
text: the archbishop of canterbury has arrived at the guildhall in leicester .
justin welby said a few words about `` looking forward '' to his visit to the city and the county .
this was followed by a few words from the city mayor sir peter soulsby .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: students sent home after water problem
text: pupils at derby moor community sports college have been sent home early as it currently has no running water .
the school in littleover , which has about 1,400 pupils , said it would provide more information later on when it plans to reopen .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : police highlight impact of knife crime
text: police in leicester have released two films showing the impact of knife crime .
it follows a week-long policing operation , which resulted in seven people being arrested and 17 knives recovered .
the films relate to the murder of lauric lebato on albion street in leicester earlier this year .
this film is a compilation of cctv evidence that shows the events leading up to the moment he is fatally stabbed .
warning : some people may find the content of this video distressing .
it may also contain third party advertising .
the second video highlights the `` total cost '' of the murder looking at the number of hours spent investigating the death and the impact on the family .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : archbishop to learn from leicester visit
text: the archbishop of canterbury has spoken about the inspirational interfaith engagement within leicester .
justin welby told the bbc he hopes to learn more about this during his three day tour of the city starting today .
during his visit he will meet local school children , leaders of other faith groups and inmates at leicester prison .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your wheely good east midlands
text: a beautiful peak district scene , an early morning tram to nottingham and leicester 's big wheel feature in this morning 's excellent selection of shots from our instagram accounts .
author: Instagram

documents.title: cricket : mullaney made notts captain
text: steven mullaney has been appointed captain of nottinghamshire county cricket club , taking over from chris read , who retired at the end of last season .
`` it 's a huge honour and a privilege to be asked to be captain of such a great club as nottinghamshire , '' he said .
`` if i can do half the job that my predecessor , chris read , has done for this club in the last 10 years , then i 'll be a happy man . ''
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: antibiotic amnesty launched across county
text: yesterday we told you about a national firearms surrender in which people were being asked to hand in their guns - today it 's antibiotics .
the nhs in nottinghamshire has launched an antibiotic amnesty for you to hand your old and unused tablets in to your local pharmacy .
it 's to mark world antibiotic awareness week which runs until sunday .

tracey lamming , from public health england , said : `` if people are not feeling well they might think , 'i might just take these antibiotics ' but they might not be the right kind of antibiotics for that infection .
`` so they may be increasing resistance because we have a big problem with antibiotic resistance . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes set to feature in international matches
text: leicester city 's jamie vardy and harry maguire could feature for england tonight .
gareth southgate 's side will take on brazil in an international friendly at wembley .
kasper schmeichel will play for denmark in the second leg of their world cup play-offs .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: watch : girl , 4 , sleeps rough for charity
text: effie bowman from castle gresley is n't your usual four-year-old .
she spent saturday night sleeping in a cardboard box at burton albion fc to raise money for a homeless charity .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: king power rejects '£ 323m lawsuit ' claim
text: king power rejects '£ 323m lawsuit ' claim

documents.title: watch : new firefighters put through paces
text: meet leicestershire fire and rescue service 's newest recruits .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : m1 delays
text: traffic has now been released after being temporarily held on the m1 southbound between junctions 26 and 25 but delays still remain .
it was after a two-car crash not far from trowell service station .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: what does the weather have in store for today ?
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: two seriously hurt in a38 crash
text: two people were seriously injured in a crash on the a38 in derbyshire last night .
a mercedes car hit the back of a stationary toyota 4x4 on the coxbench slip-road just before midnight .
the toyota driver is in a critical but stable condition in the qmc and the passenger in the mercedes , a 77-year-old woman , is in a serious condition with multiple fractures .
the mercedes driver was uninjured .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pub owner faces damage to second property
text: the owner of the texas steakhouse in foxton has told the bbc it was a `` hell of a shock '' to see his pub in flames .
shaun french said it 's unlikely the pub will now be open during the christmas period .
to make matters worse - when mr french returned to his other pub in the village this morning he found someone had attempted to break in .
he said he has reported the crime at the black horse to the police .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire at foxton steakhouse
text: six fire crews have spent the morning tackling a fire at a pub in foxton .
firefighters were called to the blaze at the shoulder of mutton/texas steakhouse just before 04:30 .
when they arrived the pub was `` well alight '' .

richard massarella , a manager for leicestershire fire and rescue service , told the bbc the fire was in the building at the front of the pub and they managed to stop it from spreading to the rest of the property .
he said it was not known at first if anyone was inside but they soon found out it was empty .
crews are now trying to work out what caused the fire .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man , 18 , admits killing boy
text: in case you missed this yesterday , an 18-year-old man has admitted killing a 14-year-old boy in nottingham .
cole mackin ( pleaded guilty at nottingham crown court to the manslaughter of reece seagrave in aspley in april .
he 'll be sentenced at the same court next month .
granting mackin bail , judge gregory dickinson qc told him : `` part of the tragedy of this case is you did not intend him any serious harm at all . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: drink-driver crashes into parked van
text: two people have been taken to hospital with `` non life-threatening injuries '' after the car they were in crashed into a parked van in chaddesden .
the crash happened off nottingham road last night - police have said the driver was over the drink-drive limit .
the passenger was n't wearing a seat belt and hit their head on the windscreen .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : latest on east midlands roads
text: travel : latest on east midlands roads
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning east midlands - dave wade and i will be looking after your live page today .
we 'll have all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the region .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can send us an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
